experiment_info.name: sacobra_rbf_optimizer
experiment_info.hypothesis: SACOBRA uses self-adjusting parameters with RBF surrogates, claimed to outperform CMA-ES for expensive functions with low evaluation budgets

tuning_runs.notes: FAILED - Score -0.1767 vs baseline. 1-src RMSE mean=0.2100, 2-src RMSE mean=0.3067. Several outliers with RMSE >0.5.

key_findings: Sequential surrogate optimization is 17.6% worse than CMA-ES
RBF surrogate cannot model the complex RMSE landscape
CMA-ES covariance adaptation is essential for this problem
surrogate_optimization family should be marked EXHAUSTED
